intro: Ranunculus pyrenaeus subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the Eastern Pyrenean buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the eastern Pyrenees. It features striking, palmately divided, bright yellow flowers with a central dark brown or black spot. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers bloom from April to June, and it thrives in moist, calcareous soils. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
